data.title: Films directed by Kenneth Branagh
data.text:
1.

Cinderella

2015 film directed by Kenneth Branagh

Overview: Cinderella is a 2015 romantic fantasy film directed by Kenneth Branagh, with a screenplay written by Chris Weitz, and co-produced by Walt Disney Pictures, Kinberg Genre, Allison Shearmur Productions, and ...

Release date: 13 February 2015

Genre: Fantasy, Romance, Adventure, Drama, Family

Director: Kenneth Branagh

When her father unexpectedly dies, young Ella finds herself at the mercy of her cruel stepmother and her scheming stepsisters. Never one to give up hope ...

0 0

2.

Thor

2011 superhero film produced by Marvel Studios

Overview: Thor is a 2011 American superhero film based on the Marvel Comics character of the same name. Produced by Marvel Studios and distributed by Paramount Pictures, it is the fourth film in the Marvel Cinematic ...

Release date: 21 April 2011

Genre: Drama, Fantasy, Adventure, Action

Director: Kenneth Branagh

The powerful but arrogant god Thor is cast out of Asgard to live amongst humans in Midgard (Earth), where he soon becomes one of their finest defenders ...

0 0

3.

Murder on the Orient Express

2017 film by Kenneth Branagh

Overview: Murder on the Orient Express is a 2017 American mystery thriller film directed by Kenneth Branagh with a screenplay by Michael Green, based on the 1934 novel of the same name by Agatha Christie. The film ...

Genre: Crime, Drama, Mystery

Director: Kenneth Branagh

When a murder occurs on the train on which he's travelling, celebrated detective Hercule Poirot is recruited to solve the case.

0 0

4.

Much Ado About Nothing

1993 period film directed by Kenneth Branagh

Overview: Much Ado About Nothing is a 1993 British/American romantic comedy film based on William Shakespeare's play of the same name. It was adapted for the screen and directed by Kenneth Branagh, who also stars ...

Release date: 7 May 1993

Genre: Comedy, Romance, War

Director: Kenneth Branagh

Young lovers, and soon to wed, Hero and Claudio conspire to get verbal sparring partners and confirmed singles, Benedick and Beatrice, to wed as well.

0 0

5.

Hamlet

1996 film directed by Kenneth Branagh

Overview: Hamlet is a 1996 film adaptation of William Shakespeare's play Hamlet, adapted and directed by Kenneth Branagh, who also stars as Prince Hamlet. The film also features Derek Jacobi as King Claudius, Julie ...

Release date: 25 December 1996

Genre: Crime, Drama, Romance, Thriller

Director: Kenneth Branagh

Producer: David Barron

Hamlet, Prince of Denmark, returns home to find his father murdered and his mother remarrying the murderer, his uncle. Meanwhile, war is brewing.

0 0

6.

Frankenstein

1994 horror film directed by Kenneth Branagh

Overview: Mary Shelley's Frankenstein is a 1994 science fiction horror film directed by Kenneth Branagh, and starring Robert De Niro, Kenneth Branagh, Tom Hulce, Helena Bonham Carter, Ian Holm, John Cleese, and ...

Release date: 4 November 1994

Genre: Drama, Horror, Romance, Sci-Fi

Director: Kenneth Branagh

When the brilliant but unorthodox scientist Dr. Victor Frankenstein rejects the artificial man that he has created, the Creature escapes and later swears ...

As You Like It

2006 film by Kenneth Branagh

Overview: As You Like It is a 2006 film written and directed by Kenneth Branagh, and based on the Shakespearean play of the same name. It stars Bryce Dallas Howard as Rosalind, David Oyelowo as Orlando De Boys ...

Release date: 1 September 2006

Genre: Drama, Comedy, Romance

Director: Kenneth Branagh

A daughter of the powerful Duke must show her courage and inventiveness to be with the man she loves.

9.

Sleuth

2007 British film

Overview: Sleuth is a 2007 thriller film directed by Kenneth Branagh and starring Jude Law and Michael Caine. The screenplay by Harold Pinter is an adaptation of Anthony Shaffer's play, Sleuth. Caine had previously ...

Release date: 30 August 2007

Genre: Drama, Mystery, Thriller

Director: Kenneth Branagh

On his sprawling country estate, an aging writer matches wits with the struggling actor who has stolen his wife's heart.

10.

Peter's Friends

1992 British film

Overview: Peter's Friends is a 1992 British comedy film written by Rita Rudner and Martin Bergman, and directed and produced by Kenneth Branagh.

Release date: 18 September 1992

Genre: Comedy, Drama, Romance

Director: Kenneth Branagh

Six former college friends, with two new friends, gather for a New Years Eve weekend reunion at a large English countryside manor after ten years to r ...

Henry V

1989 British historical drama film

Overview: Henry V is a 1989 British historical drama film adapted for the screen and directed by Kenneth Branagh, based on William Shakespeare's play of the same name about King Henry V of England. The film stars ...

Release date: 6 October 1989

Genre: Action, Drama, History, Romance, War

Director: Kenneth Branagh

The gritty adaption of William Shakespeare's play about the English King's bloody conquest of France.

Dead Again

1991 US neo-noir romantic thriller film by Kenneth Branagh

Overview: Dead Again is a 1991 American neo-noir romantic thriller film directed by Kenneth Branagh and written by Scott Frank. It stars Branagh and Emma Thompson, with Andy García, Derek Jacobi, Wayne Knight, and ...

Release date: 23 August 1991

Genre: Comedy, Drama, Mystery, Romance, Thriller

Director: Kenneth Branagh

Writer: Scott Frank

Mike Church is a Los Angeles private detective who specialises in finding missing persons. He takes on the case of a mystery woman who he calls Grace ...

13.

Death on the Nile

Upcoming film directed by Kenneth Branagh

Overview: Death on the Nile is a 2022 mystery film directed by Kenneth Branagh from a screenplay by Michael Green, based on the 1937 novel of the same name by Agatha Christie. It was produced by Branagh, Ridley ...

Release date: 11 February 2022

Director: Kenneth Branagh

While on vacation on the Nile, Hercule Poirot must investigate the murder of a young heiress.

14.

Artemis Fowl

2020 film by Kenneth Branagh

Overview: Artemis Fowl (known in certain territories as Artemis Fowl: The Secret World) is a 2020 American science fantasy adventure film based on the 2001 novel of the same name by Irish author Eoin Colfer. Directed ...

Release date: 9 August 2019

Director: Kenneth Branagh

Artemis Fowl, a young criminal prodigy, hunts down a secret society of fairies to find his missing father.

Release date: 7 September 2006

Genre: Music, Drama, Musical, Romance

Director: Kenneth Branagh

During World War I, in an unnamed country, a soldier named Tamino is sent by the Queen of the Night to rescue her daughter Pamina from the clutches of ...

Love's Labour's Lost

2000 film directed by Kenneth Branagh

Overview: Love's Labour's Lost is a 2000 adaptation of the comic play Love's Labour's Lost by William Shakespeare, directed by and starring Kenneth Branagh. The first feature film to be made of this lesser-known ...

Release date: 14 February 2000

Genre: Romance, Comedy, Musical

Director: Kenneth Branagh

An update of the classic Shakespeare story, director Kenneth Branagh shot this movie like a classic 30s musical. Love's Labour's Lost tells the ...

A Midwinter's Tale

1995 British film

Overview: In the Bleak Midwinter (released in the US as A Midwinter's Tale) is a 1995 British romantic comedy written and directed by Kenneth Branagh. Many of the roles in the film were written for specific actors ...

Release date: 10 September 1995

Genre: Comedy

Director: Kenneth Branagh

Writer: Kenneth Branagh

Out of work actor Joe volunteers to help try and save his sister's local church for the community by putting on a Christmas production of Hamlet ...

A Haunting in Venice

2023 film by Kenneth Branagh

Overview: A Haunting in Venice is a 2023 American mystery film produced and directed by Kenneth Branagh from a screenplay by Michael Green, loosely based on the 1969 Agatha Christie novel Hallowe'en Party. It serves ...

Release date: 15 September 2023

Director: Kenneth Branagh
